Message:
“Of course,
we’ll come back for you.
This is the proof
of our promise...”

I was then handed
a single silver coin.
I raised my head
to look up at my parents—

And what unfolded before me
was the same, familiar ceiling.

Wiping the sweat off my brow,
there were also traces of blood.

The stitches on my wound
must have opened up.

I don’t feel pain.
I’m what they call...a witch.

That’s why I was brought
to this shady organization
that trains assassins.

I pulled the silver coin
from my pocket and
held it up towards the ceiling,
where it glimmered
in the moonlight.

I could still recall the warmth
of my mother and father’s
embrace from that day.
The sound of their gentle laughter.

We’ll be a family again soon.
They promised me, after all...

They didn’t come today,
but I’m sure they’ll be back
for me tomorrow...right?
